column4: I am using ubuntu disk in my new bought laptop. but I cannot get the desktop. I am always in the black command modes. I am not installing the ubutu, I am just running ubuntu without installation. Any help of suggestion?
do you have the alternate install disc?
Thinkpad T400
are you using the alternate install disc?
But I can do that in my dell laptop
the one I download from ubuntu website
yea, it might be the CLI install disc
I can use that one working in my dell laptop before.
oh
No. It is not.
what happens when you run the disc?
display at low quality
I cannot get to the laptop
I like 8.04
what's the last thing that appears on the screen
command mode
ubuntu@ubuntu:
thats strange
theres the gdm you need to load, lemme find the command
I can use alt+F7 to back to my desktop. But it doesn't work in my T400
try /etc/init.d/gdm start
You are genius. It works!!!!
im not genius, ive just been in this channel far too long :P
basically your problem is the login manager (Gnome Display Manager, or gdm) wasn't loading, although i don't know why
